page.title: 17ORTON - 25 YEARS AGO
page.content: Orton, 25 years ago, was really very similar to what it is today. There were, however, more shops - Hully's, Lund's, Addison's, Rothery's, Stevenson's and Roman's.The George Hotel was there.The vicar in Orton was the Revd.James Cook.Motor cars were used but they were quite different in design from now-a-days.There were the same roads 25 years ago.Most people went for their holidays to Morecambe or Blackpool; they very rarely went abroad.There were two joiners in the village.The popular games were tennis for the girls and football for the boys.The entertainment for teenagers was going to the pictures and going to dances.There was one school which was situated near the centre of the village and catered for children from 5 to 14 years.The railway passing near Orton was more active.
